metadata.title: CVE-2022-1353 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: A vulnerability was found in the pfkey_register function innet/key/af_key.c in the Linux kernel. This flaw allows a local,unprivileged user to gain access to kernel memory, leading to a systemcrash or a leak of internal kernel information.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
